member.name: T:Tournaments.Presentation.Controllers.Games.GamesController
member.summary: API controller for managing entities associated with tournaments.
member.remarks:
This controller provides endpoints to perform CRUD operations on games within specific tournaments:
Retrieves games by tournamentEntity ID or by game ID.
Creates new games linked to tournaments, ensuring data validity and preventing duplicates.
Updates or partially updates existing games with full validation and concurrency handling.
Deletes games by their ID with appropriate validation and error handling.
Utilizes AutoMapper to map between entity models and data transfer objects (DTOs).
Implements the Unit of Work pattern to coordinate database operations through repositories.
Validates that game times fall within the tournamentEntity’s start and end dates.
Returns standard HTTP response codes such as 200 OK, 201 Created, 204 No Content, 400 Bad Request, 404 Not Found, 409 Conflict, and 500 Internal Server Error.

member.name: M:Tournaments.Presentation.Controllers.Games.GamesController.GetTournamentGames(Tournaments.Shared.Request.TournamentRequestParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves all games for a specific tournament.
member.param: Pagination and filtering parameters for the request.
The ID of the tournament whose games are to be retrieved.
member.returns: A 200 OK response containing a list of games for the specified tournament, along with pagination metadata in the X-Pagination header. Returns 400 Bad Request if the tournament ID is invalid, or 404 Not Found if the tournament does not exist.

member.name: T:Tournaments.Presentation.Controllers.Tournaments.TournamentDetailsController
member.summary: Provides RESTful API endpoints to manage tournament details, including operations to create, read, update, partially update (patch), and delete tournaments.
member.remarks:
This controller uses the Unit of Work pattern and AutoMapper to handle data operations and DTO mappings. It supports query options such as including related games in the responses. It returns standard HTTP status codes and messages to indicate operation results.
The method supports partial updates on tournament entities using JSON Patch.

member.summary: Updates an existing tournament's details identified by the specified ID.
member.param: The unique identifier of the tournament to update.
The data transfer object containing the updated tournament information.
member.returns: Returns 204 No Content if the update is successful. Returns 400 Bad Request if the model state is invalid or the input DTO is null. Returns 404 Not Found if no tournament with the specified ID exists.
